abstract.text: Representation of a single Node belonging to the mesh network.
Returns whether the Node belongs to the main Provisioner.
The main Provisioner will be used to perform all
provisioning and communication on this device. Every device
should use a different Provisioner to set up devices in the
same mesh network to avoid conflicts with addressing nodes.
Unique Node identifier.
The object represents parameters of the retransmissions of network
layer messages relayed by a mesh node.
The 16-bit vendor-assigned Product Identifier (PID).
The value of this property is obtained from node composition data.
The Heartbeat Publication object represents parameters that define
sending of periodic Heartbeat transport control messages.
The last Unicast Address allocated to this Node. Each Node’s Element
uses its own subsequent Unicast Address. The first (0th) Element is identified
by the Node’s Unicast Address.
The Publish object defines the publication configuration for a Model.
The Heartbeat Subscription object represents parameters that define
receiving of periodical Heartbeat transport control messages.
Returns whether the Node belongs to one of the Provisioners
of the mesh network.
Returns whether the Node contains at least one Model with given identifier
on any of its Elements.
A Model defines the basic functionality of a
Returns whether any of the Element’s Models are bound to the
given Application Key.
Returns whether the Node has knowledge about Network Key with the
given index.
The default Time To Live (TTL) value used when sending messages.
The TTL may only be set for a Provisioner’s Node, or for a Node
that has not been added to a mesh network.
The Bluetooth Mesh Network configuration.
Returns a list of Application Keys known to the Node, that are not
bound to the given Model, and therefore can be bound to it.
The object represents parameters of the retransmissions of network
layer messages relayed by a mesh node.
List of Scenes registered in Scene Register on the Node.
Returns list of Models from any Element of the Node matching the given Model ID.
The minimum number of Replay Protection List (RPL) entries for this
node. The value of this property is obtained from node composition
data.
An enum defining options for a location of an
The Primary Element of the Node.
Returns list of Models from any Element of the Node matching the given Model ID.
Returns list of Network Keys known to this Node.
The 16-bit Company Identifier (CID) assigned by the Bluetooth SIG.
The value of this property is obtained from node composition data.
The object represents parameters of the transmissions of network
layer messages originating from a mesh node.
The Provisioner that this Node belongs to, or
if it’s not a Provisioner’s Node.
Returns whether the Node has the given Unicast Address assigned to one
of its Elements.
Returns whether the Node has the given Unicast Address assigned to one
of its Elements.
The flag is set to
when the Node is in the process of being
deleted and is excluded from the new network key distribution
during the key refresh procedure; otherwise is set to
An array of node’s elements.
An Element is an addressable entity within a
Returns the Element that belongs to this Node with the given
Unicast Address, or
, if such does not exist.
Returns a list of Application Keys known to the Node, that are not
bound to the given Model, and therefore can be bound to it.
Returns whether the Node contains the given Model on any of its Elements.
Node’s features.
Primary Unicast Address of the Node.
The boolean value represents whether the Mesh Manager
has finished configuring this Node. The property is set to
once a Mesh Manager is done completing this node’s
configuration, otherwise it is set to
UTF-8 human-readable name of the node within the network.
Returns whether the Node has knowledge about the given Network Key.
The Network Key comparison bases only on the Key Index.
Returns whether the Node has knowledge about Application Key with the
given index.
Returns whether the Node contains at least one Bluetooth SIG defined Model with
given Model ID on any of its Elements.
Provision, configure and control Bluetooth mesh devices with nRF Mesh library.
A base class for an address or scene range.
Returns weather Composition Data has been applied to the Node.
Number of Node’s Elements.
Creates an insecure Node with given Device Key, Network Key and Unicast Address.
Representation of a Provisioner in the mesh network.
The state of a network or application key distributed to a mesh
node by a Mesh Manager.
Returns whether the Node has knowledge about the given Application Key.
The Application Key comparison bases only on the Key Index.
Returns whether the Node has at least one Application Key bound
to the given Network Key.
128-bit device key for this Node.
This flag represents whether or not the node is configured to send
Secure Network messages.
Returns whether any of the Element’s Models are bound to the
given Application Key.
Returns list of Application Keys known to this Node.
Returns whether the Node has at least one Application Key bound
to the given Network Key.
The level of security for the subnet on which the node has been
originally provisioner.
An alias for the Element type.
Primary Unicast Address of the Node.
The 16-bit vendor-assigned Version Identifier (VID).
The value of this property is obtained from node composition data.
The object represents parameters of the transmissions of network
layer messages originating from a mesh node.
Returns whether any of the Node’s Elements has a Unicast Address from the given
range.
Representation of a single Node belonging to the mesh network.
The Unicast Address range assigned to all Elements of the Node.
Returns whether any of the Node’s Elements has a Unicast Address from the given
range.
